N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1610.3 - Residential buildings

State Regulations
(a) General
provisions. (1)

Space below grade shall not
be used for dwelling purposes except on a sloping site when the floor level at
one wall is above outside grade level. (2)

In multiple dwellings, apartment entrance
doors shall have door knockers and peepholes. Such entrance doors in other
types of projects shall have door knockers. (3)

Elevators, where provided, shall be of
2,000 pounds minimum capacity. (4)

Provide conduits and/or sleeves for telephone service for all dwelling units in
multiple dwelling projects. (5)

Stair halls in apartment type dwellings three or more stories high shall be of
fireproof construction. Long halls shall be at least four feet six inches wide. Provide a slop sink closet on each floor. (6)

Provide fire wall between every four
apartments in row house projects. (7)

Subject to local and State building laws, row house projects shall be of wood frame construction, brick-veneered; three
story projects shall be of class 2 (fire-resistive) construction, buildings
more than three stories in height shall be of class 2 or class 1 (fireproof)
construction. Buildings of fireproof construction shall have flat roofs; buildings of wood frame construction shall have pitched roofs. Roof railings
shall be provided instead of masonry parapets. (8)

In row house projects, install recessed
fire extinguishers in exterior walls, located so as to provide adequate
protection. (9)

Multi-story
buildings shall have full cellars under living spaces, unless excavation is not
practicable. (10)

The floor slab of
living spaces directly on the grade shall be properly insulated, damp-proofed, and constructed. (11)

Provide storm
and screen window and door combinations for all row house projects. Notes
